item.title: Fortran routines in python, an F2PY tutorial
item.description: I'm a fan of Python and of numpy, but when it comes to doing a lot of computations it has its shortcomings. I've heard a lot of good about cython and I plan to check it out real soon. However I'm currently working at porting a fortran program to python, so it makes a lot more sense to simply compile the computationally heavy part from the fortran code in a python module. F2PY does exactly this and I'm writing this post as a reminder on how it works.

item.title: Mathematica - Transformations in a differential equation
item.description: Just a quick one. Today I needed to change variables inside a PDE. Now, I hate doing computations, and even when I do them I'm quite horrible at them. So, what better than have a software do all the hard work?
